newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE COCOA UP IN AM, HELPED BY WEAK STERLING.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE COCOA UP IN AM, HELPED BY WEAK STERLING.

text.p: LIFFE cocoa moved higher in morning trade, underpinned by a weak sterling, traders said.
By the midday break September was 15 stg higher at 1,026 stg, on volume of 517 lots. Active November was also 15 stg higher at 1,056 stg on 717 of the overall total of 2,104 lots.
"I think the bulls in the market are happy to bid it up, given the lack of selling," one trader said. Thin volume made it sensitive to being pushed up, he said.
Sterling's weakness helped push cocoa higher. Sterling fell to below $1.57.
"The pace of the fall (in sterling) has been amazing....But there is still scope on the downside," said Audrey Childe-Freeman, economist at CIBC Wood Gundy.
